events.name: Google Cloud Study Jam - Cairo #1 - Feb 03, 2018
events.description:
‚Ä¢ NOTICE: THIS EVENT ALREADY HAPPENED IN THE PAST AND TOOK PLACE AT CAIRO ON FEB 03, 2018, WE ARE POSTING HERE FOR ARCHIVING PURPOSES! LOOK FORWARD FOR OUR UPCOMING EVENTS ‚Ä¢

‚Ä¢ WHAT IS IT
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin?
Join us for our Cloud Study Jam! Together we'll work through three Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs, then you will get free access to the next quest so you can finish this series of labs at home to get a Google-hosted badge for your online profile. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Docker, Kubernetes and Scientific Data Processing, which will earn you additional badges.

Learn the fundamentals of the Google Cloud Platform, how to run containers on it and how to use the platform for data engineering. Attendees get free access to the labs ($70+ value). No need to create a Google Cloud Platform account or register with a credit card.

‚Ä¢ HOW LONG DOES IT TAKE
One in-person session of 3 hours, followed by 2-8 hours of self-study.

‚Ä¢ WHAT IS THE END RESULT
Google-hosted badges that attendees can use in their online profiles and show to employers.

‚Ä¢ IMPORTANT TO BRING
Bring a laptop (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed.

‚Ä¢ FACILITATORS:
Abdelrahman Omran / Google Developer Expert / @Omranic

‚Ä¢ IN COLLABORATION WITH:
GDG Cairo Chapter

‚Ä¢ AGENDA:
01:30pm: Three Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs
03:00pm: Coffee Break
03:30pm: More advanced GCP labs and open discussion
05:30pm: Networking then event ends

events.name: Partner Event | Mobile Developer Weekend 2018

venue.name: Information Technology Institute
venue.address_1: B148, Smart Village - 28 Km by Cairo - Alexandria Desert road, 6 October

events.description:
We are happy to announce that we're partnering with Mobile Developer Weekend. MDW2018 in its Fifth round under the theme of ‚ÄúSecure Mobile Finance‚Äù.

It gathers all mobile app ecosystem key players; developers, technology vendors, mobile experts, device manufacturers, entrepreneurs, security professionals, testers, software designers, and industry professionals.

You will go in a tour exploring latest apps, products, technologies, business and opportunities. You can also test apps, enroll in different hands-on interactive workshops and hackathons, and win prizes.

* Panels & Technical Sessions
========================
Throughout the sessions, you will get acquainted with the latest trends in the mobile world through different stops on:

‚Ä¢ Mobile Security Trends
‚Ä¢ Financial Inclusion
‚Ä¢ BlockChain
‚Ä¢ BlockChain Security
‚Ä¢ IoT and M2M Applications
‚Ä¢ IoT Security
‚Ä¢ Cross Platform Development
‚Ä¢ Native App Development
‚Ä¢ Reactive Programming
‚Ä¢ Mobile app testing
‚Ä¢ Security Testing
‚Ä¢ Automation Testing
‚Ä¢ Performance Testing
‚Ä¢ Quality and CMMI
‚Ä¢ S/W Testing and Process
‚Ä¢ Mobile UI Design / UX
‚Ä¢ Mobile Backend Development
‚Ä¢ Artificial Intelligence
‚Ä¢ Machine Learning

* Hands on Workshops
==================
In order to get the practice required to enable them in the mobile world the attendees will have the opportunity to be enrolled in diversified hands-on workshops in:

* Native App Development
* Cross Platform development
* Mobile app Testing Workshop
* Architecture Concepts
* Mobile Backend
* Cloud Computing
* Design Thinking
* UI/UX

Hackathons
=========
In a thrilling environment, participants in MDW2018 will have the opportunity to engage in a competitive setup to work on software projects to develop creative and innovative solutions in different kinds of hackathons.

The hackathons will go through the three days of the event. The first day will be the preparation training part for the hackathons and the last day will be the judging day for the different projects developed. The best ideas will win valuable prizes from our esteemed sponsors.

For more information, please visit the website : http://mobiledeveloperweekend.net/

events.name: Build Actions for Your Community ‚Üí Cairo

venue.name: Ideaspace Helio
venue.address_1: 124 Othman Ibn Afan Street, Al Matar, Heliopolis, Cairo Governorate, Egypt

events.description:
** RSVP & REGISTRATION REQUIRED TO ATTEND THIS EVENT **
http://bit.ly/gcdc-egypt-event-registration
----------------------------------------------
DATES AND LOCATIONS ARE SUBJECT TO CHANGE UNTIL ONE WEEK BEFORE THE EVENT DATE
----------------------------------------------
YOUR REGISTRATION IS SUBJECT TO APPROVAL OR REJECTION ACCORDING TO YOUR RESPONSES AND SEATS AVAILABILITY! SO PLEASE WAIT A CONFIRMATION MESSAGE FROM US BEFORE COMMITTING TO THE EVENT.
----------------------------------------------

‚Ä¢ WHAT IS IT
Actions on Google and Google Assistant are one of the major Google technical areas and we want to invite the whole developer community to learn about creating Actions for the Google Assistant.

‚ÄúBuild Actions for Your Community‚Äù is an open and modular event series designed by Google and offered to communities worldwide. We're offering opportunities to developers attending the event to learn how to build Actions for the Google Assistant that are useful for their community - whether it's a professional network, interest group, or your hometown. This way, you can build something in an area that you care about or are interested in.

‚Ä¢ HOW LONG DOES IT TAKE
One in-person session of 3 hours, followed by 2-8 hours of self-study.

‚Ä¢ WHAT IS THE END RESULT
This event series is targeting all levels of developers and we hope to see some great Actions on Google come out as a result and all of you having a ton of fun exploring what you can do with Google Assistant. We‚Äôll provide you with content to learn how to create and actually build Actions on Google. Actions will be featured online and may even be showcased at the Google I/O Community Lounge.

‚Ä¢ IMPORTANT TO BRING
Bring a laptop (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed.

‚Ä¢ FACILITATORS:
Abdelrahman Omran / Google Developer Expert / @Omranic

‚Ä¢ AGENDA
10:30 pm Welcome
10:40 pm Building Conversational Experiences
11:10 pm Conversational Design
11:40 pm Coffee Break
11:55 pm Codelab: Facts about you / Bitcoin Info / Animal guesser
12:35 am Coffee Break
12:50 am Creating your own Actions for the Google Assistant
02:00 am Feedback on the Actions on Google Platform
02:30 am Demo your Actions
02:50 am Wrap Up
03:00 am Networking / Goodbye

----------------------------------------------

‚Ä¢ WHAT IS IT
Actions on Google and Google Assistant are one of the major Google technical areas and we want to invite the whole developer community to learn about creating Actions for the Google Assistant.

‚ÄúBuild Actions for Your Community‚Äù is an open and modular event series designed by Google and offered to communities worldwide. We're offering opportunities to developers attending the event to learn how to build Actions for the Google Assistant that are useful for their community - whether it's a professional network, interest group, or your hometown. This way, you can build something in an area that you care about or are interested in.

‚Ä¢ HOW LONG DOES IT TAKE
One in-person session of 3 hours, followed by 2-8 hours of self-study.

‚Ä¢ WHAT IS THE END RESULT
This event series is targeting all levels of developers and we hope to see some great Actions on Google come out as a result and all of you having a ton of fun exploring what you can do with Google Assistant. We‚Äôll provide you with content to learn how to create and actually build Actions on Google. Actions will be featured online and may even be showcased at the Google I/O Community Lounge.

‚Ä¢ IMPORTANT TO BRING
Bring a laptop (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed.

events.name: UX MASTER CLASS ¬ª CAIRO [PAST July 5 & 6th, 2018]
events.description: 9 hours of intensive training for two days, from 8:30 AM until 06:00 PM ! With about 9 startups, mixed between early stage startups and multinational companies like Vodafone and Growth Level startups like Minrtics Team members are Doctors and professional, developers, .. etc we trained them on Google UX Master Class and Design thinking! Rhonya drove the training, and we got some excitement and good feedback.

events.name: UX MASTER CLASS ¬ª CAIRO [PAST Dec 9 & 10th, 2018]
events.description:
9 hours of intensive training for two days, from 8:30 AM until 06:00 PM ! With about 7 startups, This time we had Ranked startups in Egypt like Elmenus we trained them on Google UX Masterclass and Design thinking! As they Rhonya and Nizar drove the training.

Looking to sharpen your UX skills?
Good news! Two leading UX designers from Google will be conducting a 2-day hands-on user experience masterclass. This is a free event.

In recent years, design and user-centered thinking have been embraed by business leaders‚Äìnot just as a way to do design, but as a way to create an effective product development strategy. By attending this class with your cross-functional team, you will learn basic user-centered design processes and how to apply them throughout your entire product development cycle.

We will cover the process of taking product ideas from concept to launch, including sketching, user testing, prototyping, and making continuous improvements after launch to keep your users engaged and satisfied.

Is my startup a good fit?
This class is geared towards startups and companies that would like to improve their product development and shipping process with design thinking, and to establish a more user-centered process. We encourage teams of 4-6 stakeholders representing a wide range of functions (engineers, product managers, designers) to attend. Attendance is limited and it is free to participate, so complete the application form to be considered.

Please note: If selected, your team will be required to complete a pre-workshop exercise prior to the first day of class.

Topics covered
We plan to cover a wide range of topics over the 2-days with a focus on the following: the process of taking product ideas from concept to launch, including sketching user testing and prototyping how to drive continuous improvements after launch to keep your users engaged

Full agenda available here.
https://events.withgoogle.com/ux-masterclass-2018/

events.name: ‚òÖ [Alexandria] Cloud Study Jams & TOT
events.description:
‚òû Alexandria
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Google Cloud Platform Study Jams & TOT
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Registration required on the official website
https://events.withgoogle.com/study-jams-tot/

‚û° Dev Ecosystem Study Jams
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Study Jams are study groups complementary to Google Developers Roadshow MENA events, ran by Dev Ecosystem MENA with content from Google Developers.

The objective of the Study Jams is to increase the technical competence of the members of our community through face-to-face courses.

These trainings give the members of our community a series of skills that can be used for personal and professional development.

Join us in the second edition of Study Jams MENA!

--------------------------------------------------------------
##########################################
--------------------------------------------------------------

‚û° Training Of Trainers
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
TOT is important, because any trainer needs two separate sets of skills and knowledge; The topic they are teaching (subject matter expertise); And the know-how of transferring that information to the student (instructional expertise). Instructors need both of these sets of skills, and we train you on both.

The goal of the Training of Trainers (TOT) process is to give new trainers the background knowledge, skills and practical experience to provide communities the training and technical assistance they need.

These trainings ensures that communities have their qualified local trainers, who can conduct these workshops in a scalable & self-sustainable way.

‚û°You can enroll now with commitment & dedication!

events.name: Cloud Next‚Äô19 Extended: Machine Learning Fundamentals
events.description:
Making sense of a messy world!

Machine learning is a powerful tool for solving problems and making sense of the messy repeatable data around us.

Hard logical rules are not the way to solve really interesting real-world problems, there's a whole raft of different approaches and in fact, it's probably not one technique for everything, it's a bunch of different techniques and combinations of them.

Cloud Next‚Äô19 Extended: Machine Learning Fundamentals will include some of those techniques and helping you to take your first steps in ML:

1- Why Machine Learning?
2- Supervised Learning
3- Unsupervised Learning
4- Reinforcement Learning
5- Why deep learning and how it's different from ML.

This session is suitable for you as a participant, if:

You are a strong programmer.
You have fundamental concepts about statistics.
You know at least a little about linear algebra and calculus.
You are somewhat familiar with Python. You don't need to be an expert.

Requirements
Study Jams are designed to achieve an incredible amount of progress in a very short time. Feedback from our events around the world has shown us that practice makes perfect and it is more fun to learn if we can get our hands dirty.

The quota is limited and that is why we ask you to read the application criteria:

Have programming fundamentals and know Java or Python.
Apply and be accepted into the session
Bringing a laptop to the event: Mac, PC, Chromebook, Linux, everyone is welcome.
Computer charger.
For a better experience in the laboratories, it is necessary to have the main browser: Firefox or Chrome.

As usual, this is a FREE session, we aim to make the technology accessible for everyone with no limits. The session will be in Ideaspace Borg Al Arab, Alex.

The transportation details will be announced very soon.

Registration: http://bit.ly/gcdc-egypt-event-registration

Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin?
Join us for our Cloud Study Jam! Together we'll work through three Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs, then you will get free access to the next quest so you can finish this series of labs at home to get a Google-hosted badge for your online profile. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Docker, Kubernetes and Scientific Data Processing, which will earn you additional badges.

Learn the fundamentals of the Google Cloud Platform, how to run containers on it and how to use the platform for data engineering. Attendees get free access to the labs ($70+ value). No need to create a Google Cloud Platform account or register with a credit card.

‚Ä¢ HOW LONG DOES IT TAKE
One in-person session of 3 hours, followed by 2-8 hours of self-study.

Google-hosted badges that attendees can use in their online profiles and show to employers.

events.name: Cloud IAM Study Jam
events.description:
Can you see the difference between giving permissions and grant a specific role for your GCP resources?

Google Cloud's Identity and Access Management (IAM) service lets you create and manage permissions for GCP resources. Cloud IAM unifies access control for GCP services into a single system and provides a consistent set of operations to adopt the security principle. You don't directly give users permissions; instead, you grant them roles.

Much more is waiting for you in a 4 hour-session of interactive material and hands-on activities
To get the best out of the session, consider the following requirements:

‚Ä¢ WHAT IS IT
Actions on Google and Google Assistant are one of the major Google technical areas and we want to invite the whole developer community to learn about creating Actions for the Google Assistant.

‚ÄúGoogle Assistant Study Jam‚Äù is an open and modular event series designed by Google and offered to communities worldwide. We're offering opportunities to developers attending the event to learn how to build Actions for the Google Assistant that are useful for their community - whether it's a professional network, interest group, or your hometown. This way, you can build something in an area that you care about or are interested in.

‚Ä¢ WHAT IS THE END RESULT
This event is targeting all levels of developers. And, we hope to see some great Actions on Google come out as a result and all of you having a ton of fun exploring what you can do with Google Assistant. We‚Äôll provide you with content to learn how to create and actually build Actions on Google. Your Actions (that you will build) can be featured online and may even be showcased at the Google I/O Community Lounge.
